headline: Fact check: Ad from Ohio Republican Josh Mandel falsely claims party rival Mike Gibbons said military service isn't real work
author: Daniel Dale
sentences: Gibbons also released a video message in which he said he has "nothing but respect for those who have served," discussed his son's deployment, and said that while Mandel's military service is honorable, "you shame yourself" by trying to use it to "lie" to voters.

During a Republican primary debate on March 18, Gibbons disputed a Mandel claim about Gibbons' investments and said Mandel "may not understand" the issue because "you've never been in the private sector in your entire life."

Washington (CNN)A new television ad from Ohio Republican Senate candidate Josh Mandel is centered on a false claim that Republican primary rival Mike Gibbons, a businessman, said that military service isn't "real work."

Mandel's false attack is being supported by an allied Super PAC, USA Freedom Fund, that has launched a television ad baselessly alleging that "Mike Gibbons doesn't believe military service is real work."
